snippet: Scholars are analyzing a three-foot-tall stone carving of an armless nude that surfaced during archaeological digs last summer below a Brooklyn overpass.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; scholars are analyzing three-foot-tall stone carving of armless nude that surfaced during archaeological digs in 2012 below Brooklyn overpass; Harry C Sigman's gift of more than 100 Austrian and German objects is on display at Neue Galerie New York; suffrage memorabilia are on view at various museums for centennial celebrations of movement.
lead_paragraph: Scholars are analyzing a three-foot-tall stone carving of an armless nude that surfaced during archaeological digs last summer below a Brooklyn overpass.

headline.seo: Stone Sculpture Found Below Brooklyn Overpass
headline.main: Out of the Debris, a Stone Goddess
headline.print_headline:
Out of the Debris,
A Stone Goddess
